    Manuel Gieseking, Dennis-Michael Borde

      • getColumn

      • getNoneZeroRow

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getNoneZeroRow()
        Returns a row which has at least one component different from zero. It also returns the index of the column where a component not equal to zero was found. If such a row does not exists, than null.
        Returns:
        the index of the column with a none zero component and the addicted row or null if not existent.

      • getRowWithNegativeElement

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getRowWithNegativeElement()
        Returns a row and it's index in this matrix which has at least one negative component. If such a row does not exists, than null.
        Returns:
        the index of row and the row itself, which has at least one negative component or null if not existent.

      • deleteColumn

        public void deleteColumn(int j)
        Deletes the column with the given index from this matrix.
        Parameters:
        j - - the index of the column which should be deleted.

      • appendColumn

        public void appendColumn(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> column)
        Appends a given column to this matrix. That means adding the given column from the right side to this matrix.
        Parameters:
        column - - the column to append.

      • isZero

        public boolean isZero()
        Checks if this matrix only contains of components equal to zero.
        Returns:
        true if this matrix has just components equal to zero.
